children.FrenchText: Il est interdit à toute personne de se livrer à l’importation, à la présentation au transport, à la manutention ou au transport de marchandises dangereuses sauf si, à la fois :
children.EnglishText: No person shall import, offer for transport, handle or transport any dangerous goods unless
children.DisplayFrenchText: 5 - Il est interdit à toute personne de se livrer à l’importation, à la présentation au transport, à la manutention ou au transport de marchandises dangereuses sauf si, à la fois :
children.DisplayEnglishText: 5 - No person shall import, offer for transport, handle or transport any dangerous goods unless

children.FrenchText: Il est interdit à quiconque de se livrer à la conception, à la fabrication, à la réparation, à la mise à l’essai ou à l’équipement de contenants qui sont utilisés pour l’importation, la présentation au transport, la manutention ou le transport de marchandises dangereuses — ou qui sont prévus à ces fins —, à moins de respecter les règles de sécurité réglementaires
children.EnglishText: No person shall design, manufacture, repair, test or equip a means of containment used or intended to be used in importing, offering for transport, handling or transporting dangerous goods unless the person complies with all safety requirements that apply under the regulations.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 5.1 - Il est interdit à quiconque de se livrer à la conception, à la fabrication, à la réparation, à la mise à l’essai ou à l’équipement de contenants qui sont utilisés pour l’importation, la présentation au transport, la manutention ou le transport de marchandises dangereuses — ou qui sont prévus à ces fins —, à moins de respecter les règles de sécurité réglementaires
children.DisplayEnglishText: 5.1 - No person shall design, manufacture, repair, test or equip a means of containment used or intended to be used in importing, offering for transport, handling or transporting dangerous goods unless the person complies with all safety requirements that apply under the regulations.

children.Label: Deztest
children.FrenchText: Deztest
children.EnglishText: Deztest
children.DisplayFrenchText: Deztest - Deztest
children.DisplayEnglishText: Deztest - Deztest

children.FrenchText: Il est interdit à quiconque d’apposer ou d’afficher sur un contenant une indication de conformité exigée ou autorisée par les règlements concernant la fabrication, la réparation ou la mise à l’essai de ce contenant, ou une autre indication susceptible d’être confondue avec une telle indication, sauf si le contenant a été fabriqué, réparé ou mis à l’essai, selon le cas, conformément aux règles de sécurité et normes de sécurité applicables à l’indication de conformité.
children.EnglishText: No person shall affix or display on a means of containment a compliance mark that is required or permitted under the regulations — or another mark that is likely to be mistaken for such a mark — in respect of the manufacture, repair or testing of the means of containment, unless the manufacture, repair or testing was done in compliance with all safety requirements and safety standards applicable to that compliance mark
children.DisplayFrenchText: 6 - Il est interdit à quiconque d’apposer ou d’afficher sur un contenant une indication de conformité exigée ou autorisée par les règlements concernant la fabrication, la réparation ou la mise à l’essai de ce contenant, ou une autre indication susceptible d’être confondue avec une telle indication, sauf si le contenant a été fabriqué, réparé ou mis à l’essai, selon le cas, conformément aux règles de sécurité et normes de sécurité applicables à l’indication de conformité.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 6 - No person shall affix or display on a means of containment a compliance mark that is required or permitted under the regulations — or another mark that is likely to be mistaken for such a mark — in respect of the manufacture, repair or testing of the means of containment, unless the manufacture, repair or testing was done in compliance with all safety requirements and safety standards applicable to that compliance mark

children.FrenchText: Il est interdit à quiconque d’apposer ou d’afficher sur des marchandises dangereuses, sur un contenant ou sur un moyen de transport une indication de marchandises dangereuses exigée ou autorisée par les règlements ou une autre indication susceptible d’être confondue avec une telle indication de marchandises dangereuses, qui est trompeuse quant à la présence ou à la nature d’un danger.
children.EnglishText: No person shall affix or display on dangerous goods, a means of containment or a means of transport a dangerous goods mark that is required or permitted under the regulations — or another mark that is likely to be mistaken for such a mark — if the mark is misleading as to the presence of danger or the nature of any danger.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 6.1 - Il est interdit à quiconque d’apposer ou d’afficher sur des marchandises dangereuses, sur un contenant ou sur un moyen de transport une indication de marchandises dangereuses exigée ou autorisée par les règlements ou une autre indication susceptible d’être confondue avec une telle indication de marchandises dangereuses, qui est trompeuse quant à la présence ou à la nature d’un danger.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 6.1 - No person shall affix or display on dangerous goods, a means of containment or a means of transport a dangerous goods mark that is required or permitted under the regulations — or another mark that is likely to be mistaken for such a mark — if the mark is misleading as to the presence of danger or the nature of any danger.

children.FrenchText: Les définitions qui suivent s’appliquent au présent règlement.
children.EnglishText: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

children.FrenchText: La Loi sur la sûreté des déplacements aériens.
children.EnglishText: Act means the Secure Air Travel Act. (Loi)
children.DisplayFrenchText: - La Loi sur la sûreté des déplacements aériens.
children.DisplayEnglishText: - Act means the Secure Air Travel Act. (Loi)

children.FrenchText: Est assimilé à la carte d’embarquement le billet ou tout autre document qui est accepté par le transporteur aérien et approuvé par l’exploitant de l’aérodrome à titre de confirmation du statut du titulaire comme passager d’un vol.
children.EnglishText: boarding pass includes a ticket or other document that is both accepted by an air carrier and approved by an aerodrome operator as confirmation of the holder’s status as a passenger on a flight. (carte d’embarquement)

children.FrenchText: Application
children.EnglishText: Application
children.DisplayFrenchText: - Application
children.DisplayEnglishText: - Application

children.FrenchText: Les articles 3 à 15 s’appliquent à l’égard des vols ci-après — ou à l’égard des transporteurs aériens exploitant de tels vols — dont les passagers, les biens en leur possession ou sous leur garde ou les effets personnels ou les bagages qu’ils confient au transporteur aérien en vue de leur transport font l’objet, avant l’embarquement, d’un contrôle effectué, au Canada, sous le régime de la Loi sur l’aéronautique ou, dans un autre pays, par la personne ou l’organisme qui est responsable du contrôle de ces personnes et de ces biens et effets personnels ou bagages :
children.EnglishText: Sections 3 to 15 apply in respect of the following passenger-carrying flights — or in respect of air carriers conducting such flights — if the passengers, the property in the possession or control of the passengers and the belongings or baggage that the passengers give to the air carrier for transport are subject to screening that is carried out — in Canada under the Aeronautics Act or in another country by the person or entity responsible for the screening of such persons, property and belongings or baggage — before boarding:
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2 - Les articles 3 à 15 s’appliquent à l’égard des vols ci-après — ou à l’égard des transporteurs aériens exploitant de tels vols — dont les passagers, les biens en leur possession ou sous leur garde ou les effets personnels ou les bagages qu’ils confient au transporteur aérien en vue de leur transport font l’objet, avant l’embarquement, d’un contrôle effectué, au Canada, sous le régime de la Loi sur l’aéronautique ou, dans un autre pays, par la personne ou l’organisme qui est responsable du contrôle de ces personnes et de ces biens et effets personnels ou bagages :
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2 - Sections 3 to 15 apply in respect of the following passenger-carrying flights — or in respect of air carriers conducting such flights — if the passengers, the property in the possession or control of the passengers and the belongings or baggage that the passengers give to the air carrier for transport are subject to screening that is carried out — in Canada under the Aeronautics Act or in another country by the person or entity responsible for the screening of such persons, property and belongings or baggage — before boarding:

children.Label: (a)
children.FrenchText: les vols intérieurs qui partent d’aérodromes canadiens et qui sont effectués par des transporteurs aériens sous le régime de la sous-partie 5 de la partie VII du Règlement de l’aviation canadien;
children.EnglishText: domestic flights that depart from Canadian aerodromes and that are conducted by air carriers under Subpart 5 of Part VII of the Canadian Aviation Regulations ; and
children.DisplayFrenchText: (a) - les vols intérieurs qui partent d’aérodromes canadiens et qui sont effectués par des transporteurs aériens sous le régime de la sous-partie 5 de la partie VII du Règlement de l’aviation canadien;
children.DisplayEnglishText: (a) - domestic flights that depart from Canadian aerodromes and that are conducted by air carriers under Subpart 5 of Part VII of the Canadian Aviation Regulations ; and

children.Label: (b)
children.FrenchText: les vols internationaux qui partent d’aérodromes canadiens ou y arriveront et qui sont effectués par des transporteurs aériens sous le régime, selon le cas :
children.EnglishText: international flights that depart from or will arrive at Canadian aerodromes and that are conducted by air carriers
children.DisplayFrenchText: (b) - les vols internationaux qui partent d’aérodromes canadiens ou y arriveront et qui sont effectués par des transporteurs aériens sous le régime, selon le cas :
children.DisplayEnglishText: (b) - international flights that depart from or will arrive at Canadian aerodromes and that are conducted by air carriers

children.Label: (i)
children.FrenchText: de la sous-partie 1 de la partie VII du Règlement de l’aviation canadien au moyen d’aéronefs ayant une masse maximale homologuée au décollage de plus de 8 618 kg (19 000 livres) ou dont la configuration prévoit vingt sièges ou plus, sans compter les sièges de l’équipage,
children.EnglishText: under Subpart 1 of Part VII of the Canadian Aviation Regulations using aircraft that have a maximum certificated take-off weight of more than 8 618 kg (19,000 pounds) or have a seating configuration, excluding crew seats, of 20 or more, or
children.DisplayFrenchText: (i) - de la sous-partie 1 de la partie VII du Règlement de l’aviation canadien au moyen d’aéronefs ayant une masse maximale homologuée au décollage de plus de 8 618 kg (19 000 livres) ou dont la configuration prévoit vingt sièges ou plus, sans compter les sièges de l’équipage,
children.DisplayEnglishText: (i) - under Subpart 1 of Part VII of the Canadian Aviation Regulations using aircraft that have a maximum certificated take-off weight of more than 8 618 kg (19,000 pounds) or have a seating configuration, excluding crew seats, of 20 or more, or

children.Label: (ii)
children.FrenchText: de la sous-partie 5 de la partie VII du Règlement de l’aviation canadien.
children.EnglishText: under Subpart 5 of Part VII of the Canadian Aviation Regulations.

children.FrenchText: Vérification de l’identité
children.EnglishText: Verification of Identity
children.DisplayFrenchText: - Vérification de l’identité
children.DisplayEnglishText: - Verification of Identity

children.FrenchText: Sous réserve du paragraphe (2), tout transporteur aérien vérifie, à la porte d’embarquement pour un vol intérieur, l’identité de chaque passager qui semble âgé de 18 ans ou plus au moyen :
children.EnglishText: Subject to subsection (2), an air carrier must, at the boarding gate for a domestic flight, verify the identity of each passenger who appears to be 18 years of age or older using
children.DisplayFrenchText: (1) - Sous réserve du paragraphe (2), tout transporteur aérien vérifie, à la porte d’embarquement pour un vol intérieur, l’identité de chaque passager qui semble âgé de 18 ans ou plus au moyen :
children.DisplayEnglishText: (1) - Subject to subsection (2), an air carrier must, at the boarding gate for a domestic flight, verify the identity of each passenger who appears to be 18 years of age or older using

children.Label: (a)
children.FrenchText: soit d’une pièce d’identité valide avec photo qui est délivrée par une autorité gouvernementale au Canada et qui indique les nom et prénoms et date de naissance du passager, sauf un document délivré par une autorité gouvernementale pour la pêche, la chasse ou la navigation, quelle que soit son appellation et quel que soit le support sur lequel il est présenté;
children.EnglishText: one piece of valid photo identification issued by a government authority in Canada that shows the passenger’s surname, first name and any middle names and their date of birth, except any document, however described and regardless of format, issued by a government authority for the purposes of fishing, hunting or boating;
children.DisplayFrenchText: (a) - soit d’une pièce d’identité valide avec photo qui est délivrée par une autorité gouvernementale au Canada et qui indique les nom et prénoms et date de naissance du passager, sauf un document délivré par une autorité gouvernementale pour la pêche, la chasse ou la navigation, quelle que soit son appellation et quel que soit le support sur lequel il est présenté;
children.DisplayEnglishText: (a) - one piece of valid photo identification issued by a government authority in Canada that shows the passenger’s surname, first name and any middle names and their date of birth, except any document, however described and regardless of format, issued by a government authority for the purposes of fishing, hunting or boating;

children.Label: (b)
children.FrenchText: soit de l’une des pièces d’identité avec photo ci-après qui est délivrée par une autorité gouvernementale, qui indique les nom et prénoms et date de naissance du passager et qui est valide :
children.EnglishText: one of the following pieces of photo identification issued by a government authority that shows the passenger’s surname, first name and any middle names and their date of birth and that is valid:
children.DisplayFrenchText: (b) - soit de l’une des pièces d’identité avec photo ci-après qui est délivrée par une autorité gouvernementale, qui indique les nom et prénoms et date de naissance du passager et qui est valide :
children.DisplayEnglishText: (b) - one of the following pieces of photo identification issued by a government authority that shows the passenger’s surname, first name and any middle names and their date of birth and that is valid:

children.Label: (i)
children.FrenchText: un passeport délivré au passager par le pays dont il est citoyen ou ressortissant,
children.EnglishText: a passport issued by the country of which the passenger is a citizen or a national,
children.DisplayFrenchText: (i) - un passeport délivré au passager par le pays dont il est citoyen ou ressortissant,
children.DisplayEnglishText: (i) - a passport issued by the country of which the passenger is a citizen or a national,

children.Label: (ii)
children.FrenchText: une carte NEXUS,
children.EnglishText: a NEXUS card,

children.DisplayEnglishText: (ii) - a NEXUS card,

children.Label: (iii)
children.FrenchText: une carte de résident permanent délivrée par les États-Unis,
children.EnglishText: a permanent resident card issued by the United States,

children.DisplayEnglishText: (iii) - a permanent resident card issued by the United States,

children.DisplayEnglishText: (iv) - an enhanced driver’s license issued in the United States,

children.Label: (v)
children.FrenchText: un document visé au paragraphe 50(1) ou 52(1) du Règlement sur l’immigration et la protection des réfugiés;
children.EnglishText: any document referred to in subsection 50(1) or 52(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations;
children.DisplayFrenchText: (v) - un document visé au paragraphe 50(1) ou 52(1) du Règlement sur l’immigration et la protection des réfugiés;
children.DisplayEnglishText: (v) - any document referred to in subsection 50(1) or 52(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations;

children.Label: (c)
children.FrenchText: soit de deux pièces d’identité valides délivrées par une autorité gouvernementale au Canada — dont au moins une indique les nom et prénoms et date de naissance du passager —, sauf tout document délivré par une autorité gouvernementale pour la pêche, la chasse ou la navigation, quelle que soit son appellation et quel que soit le support sur lequel il est présenté;
children.EnglishText: two pieces of valid identification that are issued by a government authority in Canada — at least one of which shows the passenger’s surname, first name and any middle names and their date of birth — except any document, however described and regardless of format, issued by a government authority for the purposes of fishing, hunting or boating; or
children.DisplayFrenchText: (c) - soit de deux pièces d’identité valides délivrées par une autorité gouvernementale au Canada — dont au moins une indique les nom et prénoms et date de naissance du passager —, sauf tout document délivré par une autorité gouvernementale pour la pêche, la chasse ou la navigation, quelle que soit son appellation et quel que soit le support sur lequel il est présenté;

children.Label: (d)
children.FrenchText: soit d’une carte d’identité de zone réglementée au sens de l’article 3 du Règlement canadien de 2012 sur la sûreté aérienne qui est valide.
children.EnglishText: a valid restricted area identity card, as defined in section 3 of the Canadian Aviation Security Regulations, 2012.

children.DisplayEnglishText: (d) - a valid restricted area identity card, as defined in section 3 of the Canadian Aviation Security Regulations, 2012.

children.FrenchText: Dans le cas où l’identité d’un passager ne peut être vérifiée conformément au paragraphe (1) en raison de la perte ou du vol d’une ou de plusieurs de ses pièces d’identité, le transporteur aérien peut vérifier l’identité du passager au moyen d’autres pièces d’identité valides — notamment la carte d’identité d’employé, le laissez-passer de transport en commun ou le certificat de baptême — si le passager présente la pièce accompagnée d’un document qui est délivré par une autorité gouvernementale ou un service de police et qui atteste la perte ou le vol.
children.EnglishText: In the event that a passenger’s identity cannot be verified in accordance with subsection (1) because of the loss or theft of one or more pieces of their identification, the air carrier may verify their identity using alternative forms of valid identification such as their employee identity card, public transit pass or baptismal certificate if the passenger presents the identification in conjunction with documentation issued by a government authority or a police service that attests to the loss or theft.
children.DisplayFrenchText: (2) - Dans le cas où l’identité d’un passager ne peut être vérifiée conformément au paragraphe (1) en raison de la perte ou du vol d’une ou de plusieurs de ses pièces d’identité, le transporteur aérien peut vérifier l’identité du passager au moyen d’autres pièces d’identité valides — notamment la carte d’identité d’employé, le laissez-passer de transport en commun ou le certificat de baptême — si le passager présente la pièce accompagnée d’un document qui est délivré par une autorité gouvernementale ou un service de police et qui atteste la perte ou le vol.
children.DisplayEnglishText: (2) - In the event that a passenger’s identity cannot be verified in accordance with subsection (1) because of the loss or theft of one or more pieces of their identification, the air carrier may verify their identity using alternative forms of valid identification such as their employee identity card, public transit pass or baptismal certificate if the passenger presents the identification in conjunction with documentation issued by a government authority or a police service that attests to the loss or theft.

children.FrenchText: Le transporteur aérien effectue la vérification visée à l’article 3 ou 4 de la manière suivante :

children.FrenchText: en comparant les nom et prénoms qui figurent sur la carte d’embarquement du passager avec ceux figurant sur ses pièces d’identité;
children.EnglishText: comparing the surname, first name and any middle names on the passenger’s boarding pass with their identification; and

children.DisplayEnglishText: (b) - if the passenger presents a piece of photo identification, comparing the passenger’s entire face with the face displayed in the photograph.

children.Label: (a)

children.EnglishText: if the names on the identification are similar to those of a listed person, immediately inform the Minister of Transport.

children.DisplayEnglishText: (b) - if the names on the identification are similar to those of a listed person, immediately inform the Minister of Transport.

children.FrenchText: Le transporteur aérien vérifie l’identité de toute personne qui semble être âgée de 18 ans ou plus en comparant son nom avec ceux des personnes inscrites avant de lui remettre une carte d’embarquement.
children.EnglishText: An air carrier must, before issuing a boarding pass to any person who appears to be 18 years of age or older, verify the identity of the person by comparing their name with the names of listed persons.

children.EnglishText: After informing the Minister of Transport, the air carrier must not issue a boarding pass to the person unless the Minister of Transport has informed the air carrier that a direction referred to in paragraph 9(1)(a) of the Act will not be made in respect of that person.

children.EnglishText: the passenger’s appearance changed for medical reasons after the photograph was taken and the passenger presents the air carrier with a document signed by a health care professional that attests to that fact; or
children.DisplayFrenchText: (a) - l’apparence du passager a changé pour des raisons médicales après la prise de la photo et celui-ci présente au transporteur aérien un document signé par un professionnel de la santé et attestant ce fait;

children.FrenchText: Si des directives sont données à un transporteur aérien en vertu de l’alinéa 9(1)a) de la Loi à l’égard d’une personne inscrite, le ministre des Transports fournit les coordonnées du bureau des recours administratifs du ministère de la Sécurité publique et de la Protection civile au transporteur aérien et celui-ci les met à la disposition de la personne.
children.EnglishText: If a direction is made under paragraph 9(1)(a) of the Act in respect of a listed person, the Minister of Transport must provide the air carrier with contact information for the administrative recourse office of the Department of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness and the air carrier must make that contact information available to the person.

children.FrenchText: Le transporteur aérien veille à ce que tout système qu’il utilise pour se conformer à l’alinéa 4.1(2)a) ou à l’article 5 n’utilise que les renseignements les plus récents qui lui sont fournis par le ministre des Transports sur les personnes inscrites.
children.EnglishText: An air carrier must ensure that any system it uses to comply with paragraph 4.1(2)(a) or section 5 uses only the most up-to-date information provided to the air carrier by the Minister of Transport respecting listed persons.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 11 - Le transporteur aérien veille à ce que tout système qu’il utilise pour se conformer à l’alinéa 4.1(2)a) ou à l’article 5 n’utilise que les renseignements les plus récents qui lui sont fournis par le ministre des Transports sur les personnes inscrites.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 11 - An air carrier must ensure that any system it uses to comply with paragraph 4.1(2)(a) or section 5 uses only the most up-to-date information provided to the air carrier by the Minister of Transport respecting listed persons.

children.FrenchText: Lorsque le ministre des Transports avise le transporteur aérien qu’une personne n’est plus inscrite, ce dernier supprime immédiatement tout renseignement sur cette personne de tout système qu’il utilise pour se conformer à l’alinéa 4.1(2)a) ou à l’article 5.
children.EnglishText: If the Minister of Transport informs an air carrier that a person is no longer a listed person, the air carrier must immediately remove all information respecting that person from any system it uses to comply with paragraph 4.1(2)(a) or section 5.

children.EnglishText: access to information respecting listed persons is restricted to air carrier employees, representatives or contractors who require the access to carry out their duties under the Act or these Regulations; and
children.DisplayFrenchText: (a) - l’accès aux renseignements sur les personnes inscrites soit restreint à ses employés ou ses représentants ou les entrepreneurs avec lesquels il fait affaire qui ont besoin d’y avoir accès pour s’acquitter de leurs fonctions conformément à la Loi ou au présent règlement;
children.DisplayEnglishText: (a) - access to information respecting listed persons is restricted to air carrier employees, representatives or contractors who require the access to carry out their duties under the Act or these Regulations; and

children.Label: (b)

children.EnglishText: access by those employees, representatives or contractors is limited to the extent necessary to carry out those duties.
children.DisplayFrenchText: (b) - l’accès par ces employés, représentants ou entrepreneurs soit limité dans la mesure nécessaire pour s’acquitter de leurs fonctions.
children.DisplayEnglishText: (b) - access by those employees, representatives or contractors is limited to the extent necessary to carry out those duties.

children.FrenchText: Il est interdit aux employés et aux représentants du transporteur aérien ou aux entrepreneurs avec lesquels il fait affaire d’utiliser des renseignements concernant une personne inscrite, sauf dans la mesure nécessaire à l’exercice de leurs fonctions pour l’application de la Loi ou du présent règlement.
children.EnglishText: It is prohibited for air carrier employees, representatives or contractors to use any information respecting a listed person except to the extent necessary to carry out their duties under the Act or these Regulations.

children.FrenchText: Le transporteur aérien tient à jour un registre de tous ses employés, ses représentants et les entrepreneurs avec lesquels il fait affaire qui ont accès à la liste.

FR_When there is a number shown in column 8 of Schedule 1, that number is a quantity limit per means of containment for the corresponding dangerous goods in column 2. FR_The requirements of these Regulations respecting the transportation of dangerous goods other than explosives on board a passenger carrying vessel apply to a passenger carrying vessel that is transporting more than 25 passengers or more than one passenger for each 3 m of the length of the vessel.
children.EnglishText: The requirements of these Regulations respecting the transportation of dangerous goods other than explosives on board a passenger carrying vessel apply to a passenger carrying vessel that is transporting more than 25 passengers or more than one passenger for each 3 m of the length of the vessel.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 1.10 (1) - FR_The requirements of these Regulations respecting the transportation of dangerous goods other than explosives on board a passenger carrying vessel apply to a passenger carrying vessel that is transporting more than 25 passengers or more than one passenger for each 3 m of the length of the vessel.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 1.10 (1) - The requirements of these Regulations respecting the transportation of dangerous goods other than explosives on board a passenger carrying vessel apply to a passenger carrying vessel that is transporting more than 25 passengers or more than one passenger for each 3 m of the length of the vessel.

children.FrenchText: FR_The requirements of these Regulations respecting the transportation of dangerous goods that are explosives on board a passenger carrying vessel apply to a passenger carrying vessel that is transporting more than 12 passengers.

children.FrenchText: FR_When a substance is regulated in the United States by 49 CFR but is not regulated in Canada by these Regulations, a person may transport the substance between Canada and the United States by road vehicle or railway vehicle in accordance with all or part of 49 CFR.
children.EnglishText: When a substance is regulated in the United States by 49 CFR but is not regulated in Canada by these Regulations, a person may transport the substance between Canada and the United States by road vehicle or railway vehicle in accordance with all or part of 49 CFR.

children.FrenchText: FR_As provided for in section 42 of the Act, in any prosecution for an offence, evidence that a means of containment or transport bore a safety mark or was accompanied by a prescribed document is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, proof of the information shown or indicated by the safety mark or contained in the prescribed document.
children.EnglishText: As provided for in section 42 of the Act, in any prosecution for an offence, evidence that a means of containment or transport bore a safety mark or was accompanied by a prescribed document is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, proof of the information shown or indicated by the safety mark or contained in the prescribed document.

children.FrenchText: FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of limited quantities of dangerous goods on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if each means of containment is legibly and durably marked on one side, other than a side on which it is intended to rest or to be stacked during transport, with the mark illustrated in subsection (5).
children.EnglishText: Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of limited quantities of dangerous goods on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if each means of containment is legibly and durably marked on one side, other than a side on which it is intended to rest or to be stacked during transport, with the mark illustrated in subsection (5).

children.DisplayFrenchText: 1.17 (4) (b) - FR_the mark illustrated in subsection (5), legibly and visibly marked on a contrasting background.

children.FrenchText: FR_The mark is a square on point, and the line forming the square on point must be at least 2 mm wide. The top and bottom portions must be black and the central portion must be white or a contrasting colour. Each side of the mark must be at least 100 mm long. The letter “Y” may be displayed in the centre of the mark if the limited quantity is in compliance with the ICAO Technical Instructions. If the size of the means of containment so requires, the length of each side may be reduced to not less than 50 mm, provided that the mark remains clearly visible.

The letter “Y” may be displayed in the centre of the mark if the limited quantity is in compliance with the ICAO Technical Instructions. If the size of the means of containment so requires, the length of each side may be reduced to not less than 50 mm, provided that the mark remains clearly visible.

children.FrenchText: FR_For the purposes of paragraph 6(d), the line forming the square on point must be black and be at least 2 mm wide. If the dangerous goods have different UN numbers, the square on point must be large enough to include each UN number, but in any case each side must be not less than 50 mm long. The UN numbers and letters must be at least 6 mm high. The line, UN numbers and letters must be on a contrasting background.

children.FrenchText: FR_When dangerous goods in excepted quantities for which different alphanumeric codes are assigned are together in an outer means of containment, the total quantity of dangerous goods must not exceed the lowest maximum net quantity per outer means of containment that is set out in column 2 of the table to this subsection for any of the dangerous goods.

children.FrenchText: FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of dangerous goods in excepted quantities if each means of containment is marked on one side, other than a side on which it is intended to rest or to be stacked during transport, with the excepted quantities mark illustrated below.

children.FrenchText: FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), Part 8 (Reporting Requirements), Part 9 (Road) and Part 10 (Rail) do not apply to UN2857, REFRIGERATING MACHINES, and refrigerating machine components, containing Class 2.2, Non-flammable, Non-toxic gases or UN2672, AMMONIA SOLUTIONS, if the quantity of gas has a mass that is less than or equal to 12 kg and the quantity of ammonia solutions is less than or equal to 12 L.

children.FrenchText: FR_Gases that are at an absolute pressure between 101.3 kPa and 280 kPa at 20°C, other than gases included in Class 2.1 or Class 2.3, may be handled, offered for transport or transported on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage as Class 2.2, Non-flammable, Non-toxic gas. In that case, the requirements of these Regulations that relate to gases included in Class 2.2 must be complied with.
children.EnglishText: Gases that are at an absolute pressure between 101.3 kPa and 280 kPa at 20°C, other than gases included in Class 2.1 or Class 2.3, may be handled, offered for transport or transported on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage as Class 2.2, Non-flammable, Non-toxic gas. In that case, the requirements of these Regulations that relate to gases included in Class 2.2 must be complied with.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 1.32.2 - FR_Gases that are at an absolute pressure between 101.3 kPa and 280 kPa at 20°C, other than gases included in Class 2.1 or Class 2.3, may be handled, offered for transport or transported on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage as Class 2.2, Non-flammable, Non-toxic gas. In that case, the requirements of these Regulations that relate to gases included in Class 2.2 must be complied with.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 1.32.2 - Gases that are at an absolute pressure between 101.3 kPa and 280 kPa at 20°C, other than gases included in Class 2.1 or Class 2.3, may be handled, offered for transport or transported on a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage as Class 2.2, Non-flammable, Non-toxic gas. In that case, the requirements of these Regulations that relate to gases included in Class 2.2 must be complied with.

children.FrenchText: FR_Class 3, Flammable Liquids, Flash Point Greater Than 60°C but Less Than or Equal to 93°C

children.DisplayFrenchText: - FR_Class 3, Flammable Liquids, Flash Point Greater Than 60°C but Less Than or Equal to 93°C
children.DisplayEnglishText: - Class 3, Flammable Liquids, Flash Point Greater Than 60°C but Less Than or Equal to 93°C

children.FrenchText: FR_Despite section 6.1 of the Act and section 4.2 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) of these Regulations, substances that have a flash point greater than 60°C but less than or equal to 93°C may be transported on a road vehicle, on a railway vehicle or on a vessel on a domestic voyage as Class 3, Flammable Liquids, Packing Group III. In that case, the requirements of these Regulations, except paragraph 7.2(1)(f) of Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), that relate to flammable liquids that have a flash point less than or equal to 60°C must be complied with.
children.EnglishText: Despite section 6.1 of the Act and section 4.2 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) of these Regulations, substances that have a flash point greater than 60°C but less than or equal to 93°C may be transported on a road vehicle, on a railway vehicle or on a vessel on a domestic voyage as Class 3, Flammable Liquids, Packing Group III. In that case, the requirements of these Regulations, except paragraph 7.2(1)(f) of Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), that relate to flammable liquids that have a flash point less than or equal to 60°C must be complied with.

In that case, the requirements of these Regulations, except paragraph 7.2(1)(f) of Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan), that relate to flammable liquids that have a flash point less than or equal to 60°C must be complied with.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 1.34 - Despite section 6.1 of the Act and section 4.2 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) of these Regulations, substances that have a flash point greater than 60°C but less than or equal to 93°C may be transported on a road vehicle, on a railway vehicle or on a vessel on a domestic voyage as Class 3, Flammable Liquids, Packing Group III. FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of human or animal specimens that a person has no reason to believe contain infectious substances.
children.EnglishText: Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of human or animal specimens that a person has no reason to believe contain infectious substances.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 1.42 (1) - FR_Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of human or animal specimens that a person has no reason to believe contain infectious substances.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 1.42 (1) - Part 3 (Documentation), Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), Part 5 (Means of Containment), Part 6 (Training), Part 7 (Emergency Response Assistance Plan) and Part 8 (Reporting Requirements) do not apply to the handling, offering for transport or transporting of human or animal specimens that a person has no reason to believe contain infectious substances.

children.FrenchText: FR_The human or animal specimens referred to in subsection (1) must be in a means of containment that is marked with the words “Exempt Human Specimen” or “spécimen humain exempté” or “Exempt Animal Specimen” or “spécimen animal exempté” and that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the specimen.
children.EnglishText: The human or animal specimens referred to in subsection (1) must be in a means of containment that is marked with the words “Exempt Human Specimen” or “spécimen humain exempté” or “Exempt Animal Specimen” or “spécimen animal exempté” and that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the specimen.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 1.42 (2) - FR_The human or animal specimens referred to in subsection (1) must be in a means of containment that is marked with the words “Exempt Human Specimen” or “spécimen humain exempté” or “Exempt Animal Specimen” or “spécimen animal exempté” and that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the specimen.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 1.42 (2) - The human or animal specimens referred to in subsection (1) must be in a means of containment that is marked with the words “Exempt Human Specimen” or “spécimen humain exempté” or “Exempt Animal Specimen” or “spécimen animal exempté” and that is designed, constructed, filled, closed, secured and maintained so that under normal conditions of transport, including handling, there will be no release of the specimen.

children.DisplayFrenchText: - FR_Fumigation of Means of Containment
children.DisplayEnglishText: - Fumigation of Means of Containment

children.FrenchText: FR_These Regulations, except for subsection 3.5(3) of Part 3 (Documentation) and section 4.21 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), do not apply to a means of containment, or the contents of a means of containment, that is being fumigated with dangerous goods and that is in transport if the fumigant is the only dangerous goods in transport in the means of containment.
children.EnglishText: These Regulations, except for subsection 3.5(3) of Part 3 (Documentation) and section 4.21 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), do not apply to a means of containment, or the contents of a means of containment, that is being fumigated with dangerous goods and that is in transport if the fumigant is the only dangerous goods in transport in the means of containment.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 1.45 - FR_These Regulations, except for subsection 3.5(3) of Part 3 (Documentation) and section 4.21 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), do not apply to a means of containment, or the contents of a means of containment, that is being fumigated with dangerous goods and that is in transport if the fumigant is the only dangerous goods in transport in the means of containment.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 1.45 - These Regulations, except for subsection 3.5(3) of Part 3 (Documentation) and section 4.21 of Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks), do not apply to a means of containment, or the contents of a means of containment, that is being fumigated with dangerous goods and that is in transport if the fumigant is the only dangerous goods in transport in the means of containment.

children.FrenchText: FR_Marine Pollutants Exemption
children.EnglishText: Marine Pollutants Exemption
children.DisplayFrenchText: - FR_Marine Pollutants Exemption
children.DisplayEnglishText: - Marine Pollutants Exemption

children.FrenchText: FR_Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) do not apply to substances that are classified as marine pollutants in accordance with section 2.43 of Part 2 (Classification) if they are in transport solely on land by road vehicle or railway vehicle. However, substances may be identified as marine pollutants on a shipping document and the required dangerous goods safety marks may be displayed when they are in transport by road or railway vehicle.
children.EnglishText: Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) do not apply to substances that are classified as marine pollutants in accordance with section 2.43 of Part 2 (Classification) if they are in transport solely on land by road vehicle or railway vehicle. However, substances may be identified as marine pollutants on a shipping document and the required dangerous goods safety marks may be displayed when they are in transport by road or railway vehicle.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 1.45.1 - FR_Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) do not apply to substances that are classified as marine pollutants in accordance with section 2.43 of Part 2 (Classification) if they are in transport solely on land by road vehicle or railway vehicle. However, substances may be identified as marine pollutants on a shipping document and the required dangerous goods safety marks may be displayed when they are in transport by road or railway vehicle.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 1.45.1 - Part 3 (Documentation) and Part 4 (Dangerous Goods Safety Marks) do not apply to substances that are classified as marine pollutants in accordance with section 2.43 of Part 2 (Classification) if they are in transport solely on land by road vehicle or railway vehicle. However, substances may be identified as marine pollutants on a shipping document and the required dangerous goods safety marks may be displayed when they are in transport by road or railway vehicle.

children.FrenchText: FR_Responsibility for Classification

children.DisplayFrenchText: - FR_Responsibility for Classification
children.DisplayEnglishText: - Responsibility for Classification

children.FrenchText: FR_
FR_Before allowing a carrier to take possession of dangerous goods for transport, the consignor must determine the classification of the dangerous goods in accordance with this Part.
children.EnglishText: Before allowing a carrier to take possession of dangerous goods for transport, the consignor must determine the classification of the dangerous goods in accordance with this Part.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.2 (1) - FR_Before allowing a carrier to take possession of dangerous goods for transport, the consignor must determine the classification of the dangerous goods in accordance with this Part.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.2 (1) - Before allowing a carrier to take possession of dangerous goods for transport, the consignor must determine the classification of the dangerous goods in accordance with this Part.

children.FrenchText: FR_When importing dangerous goods into Canada, the consignor must ensure that they have the correct classification before they are transported in Canada.
children.EnglishText: When importing dangerous goods into Canada, the consignor must ensure that they have the correct classification before they are transported in Canada.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.2 (2) - FR_When importing dangerous goods into Canada, the consignor must ensure that they have the correct classification before they are transported in Canada.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.2 (2) - When importing dangerous goods into Canada, the consignor must ensure that they have the correct classification before they are transported in Canada.

children.FrenchText: FR_A consignor must use the following classifications:
children.EnglishText: A consignor must use the following classifications:
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.2 (3) - FR_A consignor must use the following classifications:
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.2 (3) - A consignor must use the following classifications:

children.Label: 2.2 (3) (a)
children.FrenchText: FR_for substances included in Class 1, Explosives, the classification determined in accordance with the Explosives Act; and
children.EnglishText: for substances included in Class 1, Explosives, the classification determined in accordance with the Explosives Act; and
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.2 (3) (a) - FR_for substances included in Class 1, Explosives, the classification determined in accordance with the Explosives Act; and
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.2 (3) (a) - for substances included in Class 1, Explosives, the classification determined in accordance with the Explosives Act; and

children.Label: 2.2 (3) (b)
children.FrenchText: FR_for radioactive materials, the classification determined in accordance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.
children.EnglishText: for radioactive materials, the classification determined in accordance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.2 (3) (b) - FR_for radioactive materials, the classification determined in accordance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.2 (3) (b) - for radioactive materials, the classification determined in accordance with the Packaging and Transport of Nuclear Substances Regulations.

children.FrenchText: FR_For substances included in Class 6.2, Infectious Substances, a consignor may use a classification determined by the Public Health Agency of Canada or the Canadian Food Inspection Agency.
children.EnglishText: For substances included in Class 6.2, Infectious Substances, a consignor may use a classification determined by the Public Health Agency of Canada or the Canadian Food Inspection Agency.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.2 (3.1) - FR_For substances included in Class 6.2, Infectious Substances, a consignor may use a classification determined by the Public Health Agency of Canada or the Canadian Food Inspection Agency.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.2 (3.1) - For substances included in Class 6.2, Infectious Substances, a consignor may use a classification determined by the Public Health Agency of Canada or the Canadian Food Inspection Agency.

children.FrenchText: FR_A consignor may use the appropriate classification in the ICAO Technical Instructions, the IMDG Code or the UN Recommendations to transport dangerous goods within Canada by a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if these Regulations or the document from which the classification is taken does not forbid their transport.
children.EnglishText: A consignor may use the appropriate classification in the ICAO Technical Instructions, the IMDG Code or the UN Recommendations to transport dangerous goods within Canada by a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if these Regulations or the document from which the classification is taken does not forbid their transport.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.2 (4) - FR_A consignor may use the appropriate classification in the ICAO Technical Instructions, the IMDG Code or the UN Recommendations to transport dangerous goods within Canada by a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if these Regulations or the document from which the classification is taken does not forbid their transport.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.2 (4) - A consignor may use the appropriate classification in the ICAO Technical Instructions, the IMDG Code or the UN Recommendations to transport dangerous goods within Canada by a road vehicle, a railway vehicle or a vessel on a domestic voyage if these Regulations or the document from which the classification is taken does not forbid their transport.

children.FrenchText: FR_If an error in classification is noticed or if there are reasonable grounds to suspect an error in classification, the consignor must not allow a carrier to take possession of the dangerous goods for transport until the classification has been verified or corrected.
children.EnglishText: If an error in classification is noticed or if there are reasonable grounds to suspect an error in classification, the consignor must not allow a carrier to take possession of the dangerous goods for transport until the classification has been verified or corrected.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.2 (5) - FR_If an error in classification is noticed or if there are reasonable grounds to suspect an error in classification, the consignor must not allow a carrier to take possession of the dangerous goods for transport until the classification has been verified or corrected.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.2 (5) - If an error in classification is noticed or if there are reasonable grounds to suspect an error in classification, the consignor must not allow a carrier to take possession of the dangerous goods for transport until the classification has been verified or corrected.

children.FrenchText: FR_A carrier who notices an error in classification or has reasonable grounds to suspect an error in classification while the dangerous goods are in transport must advise the consignor and must stop transporting the dangerous goods until the consignor verifies or corrects the classification. The consignor must immediately verify or correct the classification and ensure that the carrier is provided with the verified or corrected classification.
children.EnglishText: A carrier who notices an error in classification or has reasonable grounds to suspect an error in classification while the dangerous goods are in transport must advise the consignor and must stop transporting the dangerous goods until the consignor verifies or corrects the classification. The consignor must immediately verify or correct the classification and ensure that the carrier is provided with the verified or corrected classification.

children.FrenchText: FR_Classifying Substances That Are Listed by Name in Schedule 1

children.FrenchText: FR_If a name of dangerous goods is shown as a shipping name in column 2 of Schedule 1, that name must be used as the shipping name. That shipping name and the corresponding data for that shipping name in columns 1, 3 and 4 of Schedule 1 must be used as the classification of the dangerous goods.
children.EnglishText: If a name of dangerous goods is shown as a shipping name in column 2 of Schedule 1, that name must be used as the shipping name. That shipping name and the corresponding data for that shipping name in columns 1, 3 and 4 of Schedule 1 must be used as the classification of the dangerous goods.

children.FrenchText: FR_Classifying Substances That Are Included in Only One Class and One Packing Group
children.EnglishText: Classifying Substances That Are Included in Only One Class and One Packing Group
children.DisplayFrenchText: - FR_Classifying Substances That Are Included in Only One Class and One Packing Group
children.DisplayEnglishText: - Classifying Substances That Are Included in Only One Class and One Packing Group

children.FrenchText: FR_If, in accordance with the criteria and tests in this Part, a substance is included in only one class and one packing group, the substance is dangerous goods and the shipping name in column 2 of Schedule 1 that most precisely describes the dangerous goods and that is most consistent with the class and the packing group determined by the criteria and tests must be selected as the shipping name. That shipping name and the corresponding data for that shipping name in columns 1, 3 and 4 of Schedule 1 must be used as the classification of the dangerous goods.
children.EnglishText: If, in accordance with the criteria and tests in this Part, a substance is included in only one class and one packing group, the substance is dangerous goods and the shipping name in column 2 of Schedule 1 that most precisely describes the dangerous goods and that is most consistent with the class and the packing group determined by the criteria and tests must be selected as the shipping name. That shipping name and the corresponding data for that shipping name in columns 1, 3 and 4 of Schedule 1 must be used as the classification of the dangerous goods.

That shipping name and the corresponding data for that shipping name in columns 1, 3 and 4 of Schedule 1 must be used as the classification of the dangerous goods.

children.FrenchText: FR_Classifying a Mixture or Solution
children.EnglishText: Classifying a Mixture or Solution
children.DisplayFrenchText: - FR_Classifying a Mixture or Solution
children.DisplayEnglishText: - Classifying a Mixture or Solution

children.FrenchText: FR_A mixture or solution of substances that are not dangerous goods and one substance that is dangerous goods and that is listed by name in Schedule 1 has the classification shown for the dangerous goods in that Schedule if the mixture or solution is still dangerous goods in accordance with paragraph 2.1(a) and the mixture or solution is not identified by a shipping name in Schedule 1. However, if the classification for the dangerous goods does not precisely describe the mixture or solution but the mixture or solution meets the criteria in this Part for inclusion in at least one of the 9 classes of dangerous goods, then sections 2.4 and 2.5 must be used to determine its classification.
children.EnglishText: A mixture or solution of substances that are not dangerous goods and one substance that is dangerous goods and that is listed by name in Schedule 1 has the classification shown for the dangerous goods in that Schedule if the mixture or solution is still dangerous goods in accordance with paragraph 2.1(a) and the mixture or solution is not identified by a shipping name in Schedule 1. However, if the classification for the dangerous goods does not precisely describe the mixture or solution but the mixture or solution meets the criteria in this Part for inclusion in at least one of the 9 classes of dangerous goods, then sections 2.4 and 2.5 must be used to determine its classification.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.6 - FR_A mixture or solution of substances that are not dangerous goods and one substance that is dangerous goods and that is listed by name in Schedule 1 has the classification shown for the dangerous goods in that Schedule if the mixture or solution is still dangerous goods in accordance with paragraph 2.1(a) and the mixture or solution is not identified by a shipping name in Schedule 1. However, if the classification for the dangerous goods does not precisely describe the mixture or solution but the mixture or solution meets the criteria in this Part for inclusion in at least one of the 9 classes of dangerous goods, then sections 2.4 and 2.5 must be used to determine its classification.

children.FrenchText: FR_
FR_Flammable liquids included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, are included in one of the following packing groups:
children.EnglishText: Flammable liquids included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, are included in one of the following packing groups:
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.19 (1) - FR_Flammable liquids included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, are included in one of the following packing groups:
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.19 (1) - Flammable liquids included in Class 3, Flammable Liquids, are included in one of the following packing groups:

children.Label: 2.19 (1) (a)
children.FrenchText: FR_Packing Group I, if they have an initial boiling point of 35°C or less at an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa and any flash point;
children.EnglishText: Packing Group I, if they have an initial boiling point of 35°C or less at an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa and any flash point;
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.19 (1) (a) - FR_Packing Group I, if they have an initial boiling point of 35°C or less at an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa and any flash point;
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.19 (1) (a) - Packing Group I, if they have an initial boiling point of 35°C or less at an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa and any flash point;

children.Label: 2.19 (1) (b)
children.FrenchText: FR_Packing Group II, if they have an initial boiling point greater than 35°C at an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa and a flash point less than 23°C; or
children.EnglishText: Packing Group II, if they have an initial boiling point greater than 35°C at an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa and a flash point less than 23°C; or
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.19 (1) (b) - FR_Packing Group II, if they have an initial boiling point greater than 35°C at an absolute pressure of 101.3 kPa and a flash point less than 23°C; or

children.Label: 2.19 (1) (c)
children.FrenchText: FR_Packing Group III, if the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.
children.EnglishText: Packing Group III, if the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.19 (1) (c) - FR_Packing Group III, if the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.19 (1) (c) - Packing Group III, if the criteria for inclusion in Packing Group I or II are not met.

children.FrenchText: FR_If a liquid referred to in subsection (3) is a non-Newtonian substance or a flow cup method of viscosity determination is unsuitable, a variable shear-rate viscometer must be used to determine the dynamic viscosity coefficient of the liquid, at 23°C, at a number of shear rates. The values obtained must be plotted against shear rate and then extrapolated to zero shear rate. The dynamic viscosity value thus obtained, divided by the density, gives the apparent kinematic viscosity at near-zero shear rate.
children.EnglishText: If a liquid referred to in subsection (3) is a non-Newtonian substance or a flow cup method of viscosity determination is unsuitable, a variable shear-rate viscometer must be used to determine the dynamic viscosity coefficient of the liquid, at 23°C, at a number of shear rates. The values obtained must be plotted against shear rate and then extrapolated to zero shear rate. The dynamic viscosity value thus obtained, divided by the density, gives the apparent kinematic viscosity at near-zero shear rate.

The values obtained must be plotted against shear rate and then extrapolated to zero shear rate. The dynamic viscosity value thus obtained, divided by the density, gives the apparent kinematic viscosity at near-zero shear rate.

children.DisplayFrenchText: - FR_General

children.FrenchText: FR_Substances are included in Class 4 if they are flammable solids, substances liable to spontaneous combustion or substances that on contact with water emit flammable gases (water-reactive substances) and meet the criteria for inclusion in one of the divisions and packing groups of Class 4.
children.EnglishText: Substances are included in Class 4 if they are flammable solids, substances liable to spontaneous combustion or substances that on contact with water emit flammable gases (water-reactive substances) and meet the criteria for inclusion in one of the divisions and packing groups of Class 4.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.20 - FR_Substances are included in Class 4 if they are flammable solids, substances liable to spontaneous combustion or substances that on contact with water emit flammable gases (water-reactive substances) and meet the criteria for inclusion in one of the divisions and packing groups of Class 4.

children.FrenchText: FR_To determine the LC50 of a mixture of substances that are in the form of a dust, mist or vapour, when the LC50 of each of the substances is known, make the determination in accordance with section 2.17, except that for a dust use 10 mg/L as the toxic limit and for a mist use 2 mg/L as the toxic limit. For a substance in the form of vapour the toxic limit is the same as for a gas, which is 5 000 mL/m3.
children.EnglishText: To determine the LC50 of a mixture of substances that are in the form of a dust, mist or vapour, when the LC50 of each of the substances is known, make the determination in accordance with section 2.17, except that for a dust use 10 mg/L as the toxic limit and for a mist use 2 mg/L as the toxic limit. For a substance in the form of vapour the toxic limit is the same as for a gas, which is 5 000 mL/m3.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.33 - FR_To determine the LC50 of a mixture of substances that are in the form of a dust, mist or vapour, when the LC50 of each of the substances is known, make the determination in accordance with section 2.17, except that for a dust use 10 mg/L as the toxic limit and for a mist use 2 mg/L as the toxic limit. For a substance in the form of vapour the toxic limit is the same as for a gas, which is 5 000 mL/m3.

children.FrenchText: FR_
FR_A mixture of liquids with an inhalation toxicity and an unknown LC50 is included in Packing Group I if it meets the following criteria:
children.EnglishText: A mixture of liquids with an inhalation toxicity and an unknown LC50 is included in Packing Group I if it meets the following criteria:

children.Label: 2.35 (1) (a)
children.FrenchText: FR_when a sample of the mixture is vapourized and diluted with air to create a test atmosphere of 1 000 mL/m3 and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period; and
children.EnglishText: when a sample of the mixture is vapourized and diluted with air to create a test atmosphere of 1 000 mL/m3 and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period; and
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.35 (1) (a) - FR_when a sample of the mixture is vapourized and diluted with air to create a test atmosphere of 1 000 mL/m3 and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period; and
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.35 (1) (a) - when a sample of the mixture is vapourized and diluted with air to create a test atmosphere of 1 000 mL/m3 and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period; and

children.Label: 2.35 (1) (b)
children.FrenchText: FR_when a sample of the vapour in equilibrium with the mixture at 20°C is diluted with 9 equal volumes of air to form a test atmosphere and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period.
children.EnglishText: when a sample of the vapour in equilibrium with the mixture at 20°C is diluted with 9 equal volumes of air to form a test atmosphere and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.35 (1) (b) - FR_when a sample of the vapour in equilibrium with the mixture at 20°C is diluted with 9 equal volumes of air to form a test atmosphere and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.35 (1) (b) - when a sample of the vapour in equilibrium with the mixture at 20°C is diluted with 9 equal volumes of air to form a test atmosphere and 10 young adult albino rats (5 male and 5 female) are exposed to the test atmosphere for 1 hour and observed for 14 days, the result is the death of 5 or more of the animals within the 14-day observation period.

children.FrenchText: FR_If only LC50 data relating to 4-hour exposures to dust or mist are available, those figures can be multiplied by 4 and the result taken as the LC50 data for 1 hour, that is LC50 4 hours (dust or mist) multiplied by 4 is equivalent to LC50 1 hour.
children.EnglishText: If only LC50 data relating to 4-hour exposures to dust or mist are available, those figures can be multiplied by 4 and the result taken as the LC50 data for 1 hour, that is LC50 4 hours (dust or mist) multiplied by 4 is equivalent to LC50 1 hour.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.35 (4) - FR_If only LC50 data relating to 4-hour exposures to dust or mist are available, those figures can be multiplied by 4 and the result taken as the LC50 data for 1 hour, that is LC50 4 hours (dust or mist) multiplied by 4 is equivalent to LC50 1 hour.

children.FrenchText: FR_If only LC50 data relating to 4-hour exposures to vapour are available, those figures can be multiplied by 2 and the result taken as the LC50 data for 1 hour, that is LC50 4 hours (vapour) multiplied by 2 is equivalent to LC50 1 hour.
children.EnglishText: If only LC50 data relating to 4-hour exposures to vapour are available, those figures can be multiplied by 2 and the result taken as the LC50 data for 1 hour, that is LC50 4 hours (vapour) multiplied by 2 is equivalent to LC50 1 hour.

children.EnglishText: Infectious Substances
children.DisplayFrenchText: - FR_Infectious Substances
children.DisplayEnglishText: - Infectious Substances

children.FrenchText: FR_

FR_Substances are included in Class 6.2, Category A or Category B if they are infectious substances and are listed in Appendix 3 to this Part or exhibit characteristics similar to a substance listed in that appendix.
children.EnglishText: Substances are included in Class 6.2, Category A or Category B if they are infectious substances and are listed in Appendix 3 to this Part or exhibit characteristics similar to a substance listed in that appendix.
children.DisplayFrenchText: 2.36 (1) - FR_Substances are included in Class 6.2, Category A or Category B if they are infectious substances and are listed in Appendix 3 to this Part or exhibit characteristics similar to a substance listed in that appendix.
children.DisplayEnglishText: 2.36 (1) - Substances are included in Class 6.2, Category A or Category B if they are infectious substances and are listed in Appendix 3 to this Part or exhibit characteristics similar to a substance listed in that appendix.

children.FrenchText: FR_Infectious substances that are included in Category A and that are in a form other than a culture may be handled, offered for transport or transported as Category B in accordance with the conditions set out in paragraphs 1.39(a) to (c) of Part 1 (Coming into Force, Repeal, Interpretation, General Provisions and Special Cases).
children.EnglishText: Infectious substances that are included in Category A and that are in a form other than a culture may be handled, offered for transport or transported as Category B in accordance with the conditions set out in paragraphs 1.39(a) to (c) of Part 1 (Coming into Force, Repeal, Interpretation, General Provisions and Special Cases).

primary explosivesB1.11.21.43Propellant explosive substance or other deflagrating explosive substance or article containing such an explosive substanceC1.11.21.31.44Secondary detonating explosive significantly hinder or prevent fire fighting or other emergency response efforts in the immediate vicinity of the means of containmentS1.4

children.EnglishText: Documentation
children.DisplayFrenchText: PART 3 - FR_Documentation
